name: Vietnamese Green Mango Calamari Salad (Gỏi Xoài Xanh Mực)
description: Here's a delicious and refreshing green mango and calamari salad that's full of contrasting yet complementing Southeast Asian flavors and textures. You can easily substitute calamari with scallops, shrimp or tofu. Enjoy this salad with a classic fish sauce dressing.
keywords: goi muc recipe, goi muc, goi xoai muc, green mango calamari salad, green mango calamari salad recipe, gỏi xoài xanh mực, goi xoai xanh muc, goi muc, goi xoai, vietnamese goi recipe, vietnamese salad recipe with seafood, vietnamese salad recipe with green mangoes, vietnamese salad recipe with unripe mangoes, calamari and green mango salad, squid salad, vietnamese squid salad with green mangoes, goi recipe with fish sauce dressing, fish sauce salad dressing, vietnamese fish sauce salad dressing, vietnamese goi salad dressing, vietnamese green mango salad recipe, vietnamese calamari salad recipe, unripe green mangoes, how to eat unripe green mangoes, unripe green mango recipe

video.name: Vietnamese unripe green mango calamari salad with fish sauce recipe (Goi Muc Xoai)
video.description: Vietnamese unripe green mango calamari salad with fish sauce recipe (Goi Muc Xoai)

recipeIngredient: ½ cup coconut soda (Coco Rico brand)
recipeInstructions: Give the calamari a good rinse to remove any fishy smell. Pat dry with paper towels. Cut open calamari with the interior facing up. Score the interior in a crosshatch pattern then cut it into bite-sized pieces. Set aside.

Fill a small pot with water, add sliced ginger and shallots, and bring the pot to a boil. Let the aromatics release their fragrance (about 3 minutes) then add calamari. Cook for 2 minutes or until calamari starts to curl. Remove calamari from the pot and set aside.
Sliced the mango into thin strips with a julienne peeler.

Make the shrimp chips. I only use half of the package. Add 2 inches of vegetable oil to a large skillet and heat to 350°F. Add 3 or 4 chips at a time. Don't overcrowd the skillet. Fry until it fully expands out flat (about 10 seconds). Flip chips for even cooking. Transfer to a wire rack or a plate lined with paper towels to remove excess oil.

Make the fish sauce dressing. In a medium bowl, combine sugar and hot water until sugar dissolvs. Add rest of ingredients (fish sauce, lemon/lime juice, coconut soda, chili peppers and garlic). Mix until combined.

Put everything together. Combine mango, calamari, and Vietnamese coriander leaves in a large bowl. Add a little drizzle of fish sauce dressing (a little at a time to your liking) and toss to combine. Garnish salad with toasted peanuts and fried shallots. Serve with shrimp chips.
